keyFacts: The correspondence involves discussions about 18 U.S.C. ยง 1512(b)(3) and ยง 1510, with legal analysis comparing the knowledge requirements for each statute.
A preliminary statement of facts was sent on October 19, 2020, to discuss potential agreement, with explicit clarification that it was not a plea offer.
The attorneys emphasized they would not issue a plea offer before notifying and consulting with victims.
Multiple calls were scheduled between September and November 2020 to discuss legal issues and potential resolutions.
The document references case law including United States v. Escalera (2d Cir. 2020) and United States v. Grande (4th Cir. 1980) regarding Section 1510 requirements.
